properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 10:12AM EST until January 4 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...

.Precipitation on Sunday and Monday have led to minor flooding conditions
along some points of the East Fork White...White...and Wabash Rivers.
Significant flooding is not expected.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Petersburg.
* from this afternoon to Saturday morning.
* At  9:30 AM Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by this afternoon and continue to
rise to near 18.1 feet by Wednesday afternoon.  It will fall below
flood stage by Friday evening.
* At 18.0 feet...Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County
roads.  Many of the following county roads begin to flood around
this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E.
Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250
W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR  1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W
and CR 775W.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
